docs.lead_paragraph: People swimming with spinner dolphins may disrupt the animals’ resting time. But a proposal seeking a 50-yard buffer zone could hurt tourism, some say.
docs.abstract: National Marine Fisheries Service of National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration proposes ban on swimming with or approaching within 50 yards of spinner dolphins off Hawaiian coast, arguing activities place strain on animals; ban would limit popular tourist draw.

headline.main: Federal Officials Want to Ban Swimming With Dolphins in Hawaii
headline.print_headline: U.S. Proposal Aims to Distance Dolphins From Tourists in Hawaii

docs.snippet: The United States Government came under sharp attack at the opening of the seventh international meeting on AIDS here today for its policy on restricting entry of travelers infected with the disease.   The critics, including scientists and health ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Government came under sharp attack at the opening of the seventh international meeting on AIDS here today for its policy on restricting entry of travelers infected with the disease. The critics, including scientists and health officials from around the world, also attacked the Bush Administration's last-minute decision to send only a couple hundred Federal scientists -- half the size of the original delegation -- to Italy for the six-day meeting.

headline.main: U.S. Ban of Infected Travelers Attacked at World AIDS Conference

docs.snippet: In a story Dec. 17 about travel to Cuba, The Associated Press reported erroneously the number of Americans who were authorized to travel to Cuba last year. The number was 124,000, not 170,000....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Dec. 17 about travel to Cuba, The Associated Press reported erroneously the number of Americans who were authorized to travel to Cuba last year. The number was 124,000, not 170,000.

docs.snippet: A leading gay rights group in the United States said today that it would press the British Government to intercede with the Cayman Islands Government for refusing to let a ship chartered by gay vacationers dock.     The Government of the Caymans, ...
docs.lead_paragraph: A leading gay rights group in the United States said today that it would press the British Government to intercede with the Cayman Islands Government for refusing to let a ship chartered by gay vacationers dock. The Government of the Caymans, a tourist-dependent British territory in the western Caribbean, issued a statement on Thursday saying it ''regrets any inconvenience'' the decision had caused but stopping short of an apology.
docs.abstract: Human Rights Campaign, a Washington-based gay and lesbian rights organization, will press British Government to intercede with Cayman Islands Government for barring the docking of a ship chartered by gay vacationers (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Gay Group Opposes Ban by Cayman Islands
